translated: Praise of the Virtues of Buddha's Auspiciousness, Scroll 2
Composed by Venerable ÅšÄntaraká¹£ita
Taking refuge in the one who roars like a great lion, giving rise to all gateways of wholesome conduct,
Truly knowing all natures as they are, with unsurpassed knowledge and insight pervading all,
Skillfully transforming beings, with no gaps in time, proclaiming boundless Dharma gates,
First breaking through the egg of ignorance, awakening to all dharmas.
The great being who awakens sentient beings, awakening to the subtle and sublime honored ones of the Dharma,
Already clearly awakened to the principle of no-self, skillfully awakening to the intrinsic nature of all karmic actions.
Awakening to the extent of all realms, understanding the original nature of birth and cessation,
Truly knowing all dharmas of suffering, skillfully awakening to the true intrinsic nature.
Skillfully able to awaken to the absence of vexation, fully awakening to the intrinsic nature of the world,
Awakening to all causes and effects.ğŸ”½Awakening to the characteristics of liberation from the three realms,
Therefore, cultivating all extremely difficult practices,ğŸ”½The body is tireless, grasping at characteristics is skillful,
Yet not being averse to minor dharmas,
Ultimately benefiting through skillful means, proclaiming the teachings of the middle way,
Excellent is the honored Shakyamuni, bowing my head in reverence to the one who is worthy of offerings.
The supreme speaker, the silent one, my great teacher, the supreme and most victorious one,
Skillfully guiding the intentions and aspirations of sentient beings, not grasping at any characteristics.
Endowed with one kind of praise, skillfully accomplishing the four means of gathering disciples,
Skillfully proclaiming the six ways of harmonious interaction, the six constant practices are fully perfected.
Establishing the profound correct view, attaining the tranquility and goodness of all meditative absorptions,
Having already realized the path accomplished by the buddhas of the past.ğŸ”½The one who realizes the profound true path,
Opens up the profound light of wisdom,ğŸ”½In that path without investigation and scrutiny,
I bow to the TathÄgata, the one who has realized and awakened.ğŸ”½The object of knowledge of the one who possesses aggregate wisdom,
The subtle and profound is all realized and known,ğŸ”½Revealing the two kinds of nirvÄá¹‡a realms,
Fully realizing all the paths to nirvÄá¹‡a.ğŸ”½For a long time, sentient beings give rise to falsehood,
The Buddha skillfully teaches the dharma of non-falsehood,ğŸ”½Sentient beings are mired in the mud of birth and death,
The Buddha extends his hand to skillfully rescue and deliver them,ğŸ”½Those sentient beings who fall into evil destinies,
The Buddha's skillful means power is to rescue and pull them out,ğŸ”½When sentient beings give rise to the fear of birth and so forth,
The Buddha leads and shows them the place of fearlessness.ğŸ”½Endowed with vast and majestic spiritual powers oneself,
The body manifests all the precious forms and appearances,
The precious mind hidden within is wondrously perfect and bright, proclaiming the incomparable precious true Dharma.
The Buddha is not subdued by others, and no one can go against the Buddha,
Abiding in all the gates of joy, the Buddha's myriad characteristics are all perfect,
The unsurpassed Å›ramaá¹‡a's true practice, like a lotus flower blooming with pure wisdom,
Universally gathering all pure conduct without remainder, I bow to the one who has established pure conduct.
Although illuminating the worldly Vedas, he does not destroy the teachings of the sages,
Washing away all the defilements of wrongdoing, he attains the foremost supreme Dharma.
Skillfully accomplishing the methods of upholding the precepts, he is able to skillfully guide to the place of tranquility,
The guide who opens the door to good and blissful states, a good guide in the wilderness of saá¹ƒsÄra.
Always free from all darkness and obscurity, opening his joyful eyes to always observe,
Ultimately undefiled, pure and venerable, unmoved by sin or merit, practicing liberation.
Able to contemplate emptiness in one's own body, love and views already exhausted, good without defilement,
Free from thoughts and mind regarding objects of desire, free from defiled afflictions and discrimination.
The mind abides in the activities of tranquility, silent and liberated in the Dharma,
The supreme tranquility, the great sage, all pure, undefiled.
The supramundane merits are already vast, well-spread illumination in the world,
Able to contemplate all false realms in the world, the perfect true thoughts of all dharmas.
The rope of love already severed, endowed with spiritual powers, well-arousing the great light of wisdom,
Destroying all clinging minds, all intentions and inclinations are tranquil.
The TathÄgata has already left behind all faults, to be respectfully revered and made offerings to,
Eliminating all unbeneficial evil dharmas, and being in accord with all beneficial ones.
The Buddha is a good friend to sentient beings, the foremost among those with and without feet,
Abiding in the natures of mindfulness and wisdom, well-endowed with the dharma of non-forgetfulness.ğŸ”½The Buddha, regarding the self-nature of meaning and non-meaning,
Is not attached to the combination and basis,
Having already eliminated the fear of this shore of birth and death, he is able to realize the bliss of the other shore of nirvana.
The Buddha skillfully relies on the practice of the right path, listening and hearing without error, the mind without decrease,
Among all purities, the Buddha is the most honored, with vast physical characteristics and the illumination of wisdom.
The flavors of desire in the world, the Buddha's wisdom has long since skillfully escaped,
Praising wisdom and the gate of nirvana, I bow to the TathÄgata's definitive teachings.
Unstained views and unstained thoughts, unstained speech and unstained actions,
Undefiled mindfulness and undefiled concentration.
Liberation is undefiled, wisdom is undefiled, well abiding in precepts, concentration, and wisdom,
Cutting off all bonds and fetters, destroying the inverted places of afflictions.
Born from the Brahmic conduct of the TathÄgata, already abiding in the supreme cool and refreshing ground,
The most tranquil one among all doers, not attached to worldly affairs of respect and love.
Already able to sever the five bonds, and also able to fully possess the six dharmas,
Giving rise to a mind of equal protection and mindfulness, the four supports accomplished without deficiency.
Pure and true, without distinction, equally abandoning worldly attachments,
Without inverted thoughts, with a genuine mind, having already attained all forms of ease.
Mind well liberated, wisdom liberated, pure Brahmic conduct well established,
The TathÄgata, the supreme excellent man, is thus praised and taken refuge in.
I bow to the supreme great arhat, who is free from names, characteristics, and states,
Transcending the gate of names, characteristics, and states, names, characteristics, and states are all quiescent.
The well-seen mind can extinguish the flames of desire, and all the defilements of attachment to objects of desire are removed.
Free from the hidden afflictions of all desires, and free from all faults of desire,
Skillfully cultivating the seven kinds of contemplation methods, skillfully expounding the Dharma door of the factors of enlightenment,
All have already been able to conquer others, the Buddha is the courageous and fearless one.
Free from delusion, cutting off defilements, supreme among the supreme, with the power of precepts, the unsurpassed one,
Endowed with good wisdom and subtle mind, inwardly embracing various meritorious practices,
Free from doubt, defilements, and always content, having already extinguished the false sources of the world,
The deeds of the great Å›ramaá¹‡a are accomplished, I bow my head to the one who is truly joyful.
The Buddha is the most excellent in the world, having already well observed his body,
Having attained what should be attained, the various teachings, I bow to the TathÄgata, incomparable and unsurpassed.
Right mindfulness, supreme observation, all-enlightened, not subdued by others, able to subdue others,
Having already attained tranquility, with nothing to do, I bow to the most excellent one among bulls.
Immeasurable, extremely profound, abiding in silence, right wisdom always practicing the blissful practice,
In accordance with the Dharma and Vinaya, with wonderful deportment, I bow to the one whose body is adorned and mind is tranquil.
The wonderful perfection of practices, speaking well, manifesting the appearance of austerities with the body,
Words without frivolous disputes, abiding in the true reality, I bow to the one free from greed, the one with right livelihood.
The TathÄgata is most excellent and also self-mastery, just like Åšakra is most excellent among the gods,
Going in the right direction, and also well observing, speaking humbly and harmoniously.
All pure ones, the pure one, the one with good love, the one without attachment, the one with vast purity,
The one whose merit of maturity is filled with fragrance, I bow my head to the one who has already reached the supreme place.
The Buddha is the supreme great sage king, who has accumulated merit extensively and is full without decrease,
The one whose pure conduct has been perfected and flattery has been removed, I bow my head to the one who is a mass of light of right wisdom.
The one whose body and mind are pure and also light and at ease, who has already put to rest all enmity and opposition,
The one who is revered for his tranquil wisdom, vast wisdom, and great wisdom, who has blocked the source of anger and is always joyful,
The one who is supreme among pudgalas, who is immeasurable, free from all attachments,
The one who has penetrated the collection of phrases and is already free from doubt, I bow my head to the skillful one who is good at understanding.
The supreme one in teaching and taming, the unsurpassed lovable one who creates light,
Without seeking, without arrogance, without attachment, I bow to the one who is free from deception and pure.
Already free from darkness and obscurations, unstained, supreme among individuals,
Having attained tranquility and great fame, I bow to the one who is unattached and unbound.
Delusion and attachment have long been abandoned, the view of self and grasping at characteristics are eliminated,
The Dharma is proclaimed as good in the beginning, middle, and end, with excellent words and meanings all complete.
Beings suffer without weariness, but through the Buddha's skillful means they are caused to rest,
Beings do not enter the door of liberation, but through the Buddha's skillful means they are caused to leave,
The TathÄgata does not abide in the Dharma of cessation, but always practices to save and liberate the world,
And in the vast and correct Dharma gate, I bow to the great wisdom that encompasses all.
Having ceased all false and deluded discriminations, skillfully avoiding all paths of seeking,
Urging the eradication of evil dharmas, he is called the supreme person, free from the seven kinds of defilements, perfecting the pure practice of Brahmins,
Like space, the mud of desire cannot defile him, always pure, relying on the practice of Brahmins.
Although he has eliminated defiled dharmas, he understands their empty nature, transcending language, his mind unattached,
The Buddha always abides in the nature of mindfulness of the body, the Buddha's mind has transcended the two extremes,
The honored one of profound secret and courageous strength, the one with a good body in the gate of auspiciousness.
I bow to the inconceivable great compassion, all that is done by one's own spiritual powers,
Helping those who are weak and inferior to cultivate, certainly following those whose goodness is beautiful.
The Buddha has a body as solid as vajra, born from the place of truth,
Abiding in all the corresponding gates, attaining the supreme bliss of great nirvana.
The TathÄgata has already attained the supreme benefit, abandoning his own bliss and not clinging to it,
Leading and showing the world to a place of peace and security, extensively speaking the right path for sentient beings.
Taking refuge in the greatly enlightened Honored One, who has presently realized the path of right enlightenment,
For those who do not cultivate pure conduct, the Buddha skillfully establishes them.
The Buddha is the knower of the path, the one who recognizes the path and speaks the path,
The Buddha is the Honored One of the right path, to whom all paths return.
The Buddha is born from illumination, and is also the one born from wisdom,
Born from meaning and born from the Dharma, skillfully illuminating the meaning of illumination.
The one who emerges from all meanings, the great lion among men,
The great elephant dragon among men, the great sage king among men,
The one with right knowledge among men, the Honored One of wisdom and valor among men,
The unsurpassed victor among men, the most supreme among men,
The extraordinary man among men, the white lotus flower among men.
Without fear or alarm, without cowardice or apprehension,
The Buddha is the one who is free from fear, fearless, and without haste.
He removes fear, danger, and difficulty, and eliminates all fears and difficulties.
He himself has escaped from the realm of fear and also causes others to escape.ğŸ”½He himself cuts off fear and difficulty and also causes others to cut them off.
He himself crosses the ocean of fear and difficulty and also causes others to cross it.
He is free from horripilation and free from the bristling of the body.
The Buddha is supreme, incomparable, equal, and also without any equal.
His merits are immeasurable, and he has already transcended measurement.
He cannot be grasped or taken as an image, and he has no separate parts.
The superior person is unique, without a second.
The Buddha is the one with natural wisdom, and there is no one equal to him.
He widely benefits all sentient beings, and I bow to the one with omniscience.
In the worlds of gods, humans, and the world, among Brahmas, demons, and ascetics,
The Buddha is the most supreme and honored one, and also has no equal.
The Buddha-Jewel is extremely rare and also difficult to obtain.
Encountering the Buddha-Jewel's appearance in the world is truly rare and difficult.
The Buddha is the great eye, and also the great light,
The great luminary, the great illumination, the great lamp, the great torch,
The great bright light without darkness, who has attained the supreme Dharma,
Whose faculties, powers, and path of enlightenment are perfect, and are not shared with the Å›rÄvakas.
If there is no beneficial matter, the TathÄgata will not appear in the world,
If there is no benefit, he will not manifest, and if there is no benefit, he will not conceal himself.
The Buddha appears in the world for the benefit of all beings,
Out of compassion for the world, he performs all beneficial and joyful deeds.
Among all gods and humans, the Buddha is the one with right view,
With the right path and Dharma, he universally teaches and shows all.
Moreover, among all the assemblies, the Buddha is the most beloved and revered,
All give rise to respectful and loving thoughts, and contemplate with a sense of reverence,
The Buddha is the one to be closely attended to, and to follow with respect,
Bowing one's head to see the true suchness, the most auspicious and supreme treasure.
The Buddha's wisdom eye is radiant, and further arises from the wisdom eye,ğŸ”½Developing the bright flames of wisdom, holding the torch of vast wisdom,
Kindling the lamp of wisdom to shine everywhere, great wisdom dispelling all darkness.
The intrinsic nature of all existences, the TathÄgata fully illuminates,
The TathÄgata's faculty of wisdom is subtle and most supreme.
The TathÄgata's power of great wisdom cannot be subdued,
Accumulating inexhaustible wealth of wisdom, possessing priceless treasures of wisdom,
Holding the sharp sword of wisdom, wielding the supreme weapon of wisdom,
Wielding the sharp sword of wisdom, wisdom is without decline or diminution.
Awakening to all dharmas,
With vast wisdom as the palace, the one with right knowledge abides there.
With firm wisdom as the walls, he is closely guarded all around,
With inconceivable right wisdom, he advances by way of the steps.
The supreme one who is invincible, abiding with a mind free from duality,
Not being subdued by others, subduing without grasping,
The one who is to be honored in the three realms,
Observing all without attachment to anything,
Knowing what is to be known, abandoning what is to be abandoned,
Attaining what is to be attained, accomplishing the supreme deeds,
Having completed all his own affairs, he teaches the world.
The Buddha is the great sage, his diligence is unprecedented,
Having already established purity, his vast practices are rare,
Manifesting the supreme path, rare and inconceivable Dharma,
Obtaining the supreme phrase, drinking the sweet dew of nirvana.
Pulling out the roots of the net of craving, severing the basis of all faults,
Good conduct is without distinction, the unstained Dharma cannot be attached,ğŸ”½Good birth and good essence, leaving behind the excellent good,
The source of the roots of goodness, I bow to the one who has come well.
Unmoving and inconceivable, the wise one is the most revered among the wise,
Flattery, faults, and defilements are removed, already crossed over the ocean of afflictions,
Harmonious conduct and liberation, liberated from all entanglements,
Already attained the mind without grasping, already exhausted all outflows,
Already exhausted the edge of faults, already shattered all poisons,
Already severed all obstructions, completely burned the net of views.
All false and deluded words, and false and deluded views and hearing,
Wrong thoughts and actions, the Buddha has completely left behind.
The aggregates, sense bases, and elements, the teachings are well-expounded in detail and in brief,
Relying on purity, free from bondage, supreme among all supports.
For those without refuge, the Buddha becomes their refuge,
For those without direction, the Buddha becomes their direction.
Having already crossed the ocean of birth and death, pervading all realms,
Wherever there is need for manifestation, he is able to reach everywhere.
For those who have fallen into evil destinies, the Buddha always knows and always thinks,
And with skillful means, he universally saves and delivers them.
Free from greed, hatred, and delusion, endowed with the roots of goodness,
The great body, the eternally abiding body, the compassionate and beneficial one.
The body is clothed in the robes of the ÅšÄkya clan, performing auspicious deeds extensively,
With the power of extraordinary diligence, the one of great wisdom and right understanding.
The Dharma of precepts and patience is true, and the inner mind is always diligent,
Vast and also very profound, endowed with all merits,
The light is greatly illuminating, the mind is tamed and pure,
Like still water clear and calm, the good seeds manifest perfectly.
The pure eye of the world, like a blue utpala flower,
Vast and extremely wonderful, pervading the worlds in the ten directions,
The nature of tranquility is moistening, the wonderful moon of omniscience,
The Buddha's virtues are vast and boundless, therefore I praise him.Here is the corrected and aligned text:
Praise of the Auspicious Virtues of the Buddha, Scroll 2
